pullRequest.body:
These results make use of the fact that `Set.ncard` is defined to be 0, therefore
in the infinite case the cardinality is also considered even, in which case the set
also cleanly splits in two.

---

nodes.body: please_merge_master.md
By the way, would it be cleaner to implement these results in terms of [IsCompl](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Disjoint.html#IsCompl)?

> By the way, would it be cleaner to implement these results in terms of [IsCompl](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Disjoint.html#IsCompl)?

I'm not sure, this would entail casting `t` and `u` to `Set s`, right? I'm happy to defer to your expertise here. (I'm going to refactor once your PR is merged).
Oh you're right, the assumption here is `t ∪ u = s` instead of `t ∪ u = univ`. So I think it's fine as is.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18933~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!

I'm really sorry for the delay on my PR! You should now be able to implement my suggestions.

> I might suggest proving the infinite version first. Then you can drop the finiteness assumption from the `ncard` version and golf the `iff` version. Something like this:
> 
> ```
> open Cardinal
> 
> theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite (h : s.Infinite) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
>     t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
>   have := h.to_subtype
>   have f : s ≃ s ⊕ s := by
>     apply Classical.choice
>     rw [← Cardinal.eq, ← add_def, add_mk_eq_self]
>   refine ⟨Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inl)), Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inr)), ?_, ?_, ?_⟩
>   · rw [← image_union, ← preimage_union]
>     simp
>   · exact disjoint_image_of_injective Subtype.val_injective
>       (isCompl_range_inl_range_inr.disjoint.preimage f)
>   · simp [mk_image_eq Subtype.val_injective]
> 
> theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
>     t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
>   obtain hs | hs := s.infinite_or_finite
>   · exact exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite hs
>   classical
>   rw [ncard_eq_toFinset_card s hs] at he
>   obtain ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, hctu⟩ := Finset.exists_disjoint_union_of_even_card he
>   use t.toSet, u.toSet
>   simp [← Finset.coe_union, *]
> 
> theorem exists_union_disjoint_ncard_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
>     t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ t.ncard = u.ncard := by
>   obtain ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, hctu⟩ := exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even he
>   exact ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, congrArg Cardinal.toNat hctu⟩
> 
> theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_iff (s : Set α) :
>     Even (s.ncard) ↔ ∃ (t u : Set α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
>   use exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even
>   rintro ⟨t, u, rfl, hdtu, hctu⟩
>   obtain hfin | hnfin := (t ∪ u).finite_or_infinite
>   · rw [finite_union] at hfin
>     have hn : t.ncard = u.ncard := congrArg Cardinal.toNat hctu
>     rw [ncard_union_eq hdtu hfin.1 hfin.2, hn]
>     exact Even.add_self u.ncard
>   · simp only [hnfin.ncard, even_zero]
> ```

Adopted your suggestions, thanks!

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: pimotte can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Thanks! Please wait for CI before merging.

bors d+

I might suggest proving the infinite version first. Then you can drop the finiteness assumption from the `ncard` version and golf the `iff` version. Something like this:
```
open Cardinal

theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite (h : s.Infinite) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  have := h.to_subtype
  have f : s ≃ s ⊕ s := by
    apply Classical.choice
    rw [← Cardinal.eq, ← add_def, add_mk_eq_self]
  refine ⟨Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inl)), Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inr)), ?_, ?_, ?_⟩
  · rw [← image_union, ← preimage_union]
    simp
  · exact disjoint_image_of_injective Subtype.val_injective
      (isCompl_range_inl_range_inr.disjoint.preimage f)
  · simp [mk_image_eq Subtype.val_injective]

theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  obtain hs | hs := s.infinite_or_finite
  · exact exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite hs
  classical
  rw [ncard_eq_toFinset_card s hs] at he
  obtain ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, hctu⟩ := Finset.exists_disjoint_union_of_even_card he
  use t.toSet, u.toSet
  simp [← Finset.coe_union, *]

theorem exists_union_disjoint_ncard_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ t.ncard = u.ncard := by
  obtain ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, hctu⟩ := exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even he
  exact ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, congrArg Cardinal.toNat hctu⟩

theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_iff (s : Set α) :
    Even (s.ncard) ↔ ∃ (t u : Set α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  use exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even
  rintro ⟨t, u, rfl, hdtu, hctu⟩
  obtain hfin | hnfin := (t ∪ u).finite_or_infinite
  · rw [finite_union] at hfin
    have hn : t.ncard = u.ncard := congrArg Cardinal.toNat hctu
    rw [ncard_union_eq hdtu hfin.1 hfin.2, hn]
    exact Even.add_self u.ncard
  · simp only [hnfin.ncard, even_zero]
```

I might suggest proving the infinite version first. Then you can drop the finiteness assumption from the `ncard` version and golf the `iff` version. Something like this:
```
open Cardinal

theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite (h : s.Infinite) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  have := h.to_subtype
  have f : s ≃ s ⊕ s := by
    apply Classical.choice
    rw [← Cardinal.eq, ← add_def, add_mk_eq_self]
  refine ⟨Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inl)), Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inr)), ?_, ?_, ?_⟩
  · rw [← image_union, ← preimage_union]
    simp
  · exact disjoint_image_of_injective Subtype.val_injective
      (isCompl_range_inl_range_inr.disjoint.preimage f)
  · simp [mk_image_eq Subtype.val_injective]

theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  obtain hs | hs := s.infinite_or_finite
  · exact exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite hs
  classical
  rw [ncard_eq_toFinset_card s hs] at he
  obtain ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, hctu⟩ := Finset.exists_disjoint_union_of_even_card he
  use t.toSet, u.toSet
  simp [← Finset.coe_union, *]

theorem exists_union_disjoint_ncard_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ t.ncard = u.ncard := by
  obtain ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, hctu⟩ := exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even he
  exact ⟨t, u, hutu, hdtu, congrArg Cardinal.toNat hctu⟩

theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_iff (s : Set α) :
    Even (s.ncard) ↔ ∃ (t u : Set α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  use exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even
  rintro ⟨t, u, rfl, hdtu, hctu⟩
  obtain hfin | hnfin := (t ∪ u).finite_or_infinite
  · rw [finite_union] at hfin
    have hn : t.ncard = u.ncard := congrArg Cardinal.toNat hctu
    rw [ncard_union_eq hdtu hfin.1 hfin.2, hn]
    exact Even.add_self u.ncard
  · simp only [hnfin.ncard, even_zero]
```

Thanks! Please wait for CI before merging.

bors d+

It looks like this one is a lot easier to prove first for finsets:
```
theorem exists_disjoint_union_of_even_card [DecidableEq α] (s : Finset α) (he : Even #s) :
    ∃ (t u : Finset α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u :=
  let ⟨n, hn⟩ := he
  let ⟨t, ht, ht'⟩ := exists_subset_card_eq (show n ≤ #s by omega)
  ⟨t, s \ t, by simp [card_sdiff, disjoint_sdiff, *]⟩
```
and then you can transfer that to a result for `Set`, which should make this proof quite a bit nicer!
That is nice! Fixed:)
Note that importing cardinal arithmetic also requires importing ordinals. Arguably not a big deal, but something that's good to keep in mind.
Yep, if this means it's better to split this to a separate file, I'm open to that:)
Yes, I don't think we can import cardinals and ordinals in such a basic file as `Data.Set.Card`. Can you use `#find_home` to find a better place for `exists_union_disjoint...` lemmas?

`#find_home` only gave `[Mathlib]`, so I've extracted these results and the result for `Finset` to a new file. (The `#find_home` for the `Finset` result gave a laundry list of options and none of them seemed really fitting)
Can you use `#` notation for `Cardinal.mk` here?
I might be missing something, but I could only find `#` notation for Finset, does it also exist for Set?
The notation is in the `Cardinal` namespace.
Fixed:)

```suggestion
```
Fixed:)

#18933 introduces a few simple lemmas on cardinalities. With them, this proof can be golfed down to:
```suggestion
theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite (h : s.Infinite) : ∃ (t u : Set α),
    t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
  have := h.to_subtype
  have f : s ≃ s ⊕ s := by
    apply Classical.choice
    rw [← Cardinal.eq, ← add_def, add_mk_eq_self]
  refine ⟨Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inl)), Subtype.val '' (f ⁻¹' (range .inr)), ?_, ?_, ?_⟩
  · rw [← image_union, ← preimage_union]
    simp
  · exact disjoint_image_of_injective Subtype.val_injective
      (isCompl_range_inl_range_inr.disjoint.preimage f)
  · simp [mk_image_eq Subtype.val_injective]
```
If you're not going to use this namespace elsewhere, you can instead do `open Cardinal in` in the theorem that uses this.
It's for the two theorems at the end of the file, so I could see the argument for either one, do you prefer one `open` or two `open in`?
Well, I guess one open is better.

Nitpick, but why not fold the first `disjoint_comm` into the `rw`?
```suggestion
theorem disjoint_insert_right : Disjoint s (insert a t) ↔ a ∉ s ∧ Disjoint s t := by
  rw [disjoint_comm, disjoint_insert_left, disjoint_comm]
```
Starting the proof with `apply Classical.choice` seems weird. You can prove that the thing exists and then obtain it (since you are proving something Lean should not complain).
Fixed!

Conclusions should be stated on one line, if possible.
```suggestion
theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_infinite (h : s.Infinite)
    ∃ (t u : Set α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
```
Also, perhaps consider naming this (`Set.`)`Infinite.exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq` to take advantage of dot notation.

```suggestion
theorem exists_union_disjoint_cardinal_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) :
    ∃ (t u : Set α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ #t = #u := by
```

```suggestion
theorem exists_union_disjoint_ncard_eq_of_even (he : Even s.ncard) :
    ∃ (t u : Set α), t ∪ u = s ∧ Disjoint t u ∧ t.ncard = u.ncard := by
```
Please add an `iff` version of this theorem to mirror the one for `Set`.
Done:)

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Set): add result that shows a set is even iff it splits into two sets of equal cardinality
